name: Serious 6
description: Serious 6 from Serious Seeds mixes undefined Canadian genetics with sativa landraces from Africa. It is known for its small leaves and a colorful phenotype that shows pink pistils. Almost a pure sativa, Serious 6 boasts a spicy citrus aroma with a clear-headed cerebral buzz of effects that spark creativity and give a burst of energy.
descriptionPlain: Serious 6 from Serious Seeds mixes undefined Canadian genetics with sativa landraces from Africa. It is known for its small leaves and a colorful phenotype that shows pink pistils. Almost a pure sativa, Serious 6 boasts a spicy citrus aroma with a clear-headed cerebral buzz of effects that spark creativity and give a burst of energy.

highlightedReviews.text: This is the most impressive I have ever had. It is wonderful. Love S6. The arousal feeling is very good.
I was having a panic attack, but I'm fine now.

articles.title: A Thanksgiving at the Cannabis Cup: Day 5
articles.author: Anna Wilcox
articles.text:
Happy Thanksgiving, Leafly readers! Today the Cannabis Cup comes to an end. I think that it’s safe to say that all of the participants this year have presented some great products. From DNA Genetics, Paradise Seeds, and Green House to Serious Seeds and Big Buddha Seeds, everyone seemed to have brought their A-game.
I would like to offer a sincere congratulations to the following cannabis companies for presenting incredible flower:

Green Place, winning first place coffeeshop flower for Rollex OG Kush;
Green House, winning second place coffeeshop flower for Flowerbomb Kush;
and Bush Doctor Coffeeshop, winning third place for Tangie.

While I was thoroughly impressed with the rock star strains such as Tangie and Flowerbomb Kush, I also was pleasantly surprised by Serious 6, a product of Switzerland-based Serious Seeds. What I found most striking about this sativa was its taste—a light, herbal, pleasant flavor that is a little challenging to describe. It wasn’t quite like anything that I have ever tasted before, and as a foodie wannabe, that’s a definite good quality in my book.
Having now gone through my first full Cannabis Cup, I am realizing that it is almost impossible to see everything and do everything you really wish you could. While spending time at the coffeeshops is a definite must, the seminars held today at the Cup were particularly fascinating. Hearing Ben Dronkers of Sensi Seeds talk about his accomplishments, new ventures, and how Sensi Seeds came to be was incredible. He put up a slideshow of old photos and as he looked at the old images, recalling each moment, you could feel for yourself the happiness of a life filled with great experiences and even better memories.
Spending Thanksgiving at the Cannabis Cup is far from the holiday tradition, but spending the past five days around people filled with such energy and a never-ending love for what they do is something to be thankful for. I would like to take this time to say “thank you” to all of the wonderful people I have met this week, and to all of those in the cannabis industry who have worked to gain acceptance for this plant and share their passion with the world.
If you are intersted in learning about the winners in every High Times Cannabis Cup category, please click here.
I hope you had a wonderful holiday,
Anna
P.S. I wasn't able to use my own photos in this post because my camera has mysteriously gone MIA. Sorry, folks.
Photo credit: mau_ry via photopin cc

growInfo.growNotes:
Bred to be mold resistant
	Finishes early outdoors
	55-60 days flowering
